channel.title: AI Unfiltered
channel.description: Chinese AI • Open Source • Security • Incidents. Signal, not noise.

item.title: Some users are experiencing delays in purchasing additional API credits
item.description: Jan 29, 19:51 UTCIdentified - Some customers are experiencing delays in having their successful credit purchases applied and in triggering credit auto-reloads. We have identified the issue and are working to resolve.Jan 29, 19:10 UTCInvestigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: Introducing NVIDIA Cosmos Policy for Advanced Robot Control
Project Genie: Experimenting with infinite, interactive worlds
item.description: Google AI Ultra subscribers in the U.S. can try out Project Genie, an experimental research prototype that lets you create and explore worlds.

item.title: LLMs Hijacked, Monetized in ‘Operation Bizarre Bazaar’
item.description: An LLMjacking operation has been targeting exposed LLMs and MCPs at scale, for commercial monetization. The post LLMs Hijacked, Monetized in ‘Operation Bizarre Bazaar’ appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: N8n Vulnerabilities Could Lead to Remote Code Execution
item.description: The two bugs impacted n8n’s sandbox mechanism and could be exploited via weaknesses in the AST sanitization logic. The post N8n Vulnerabilities Could Lead to Remote Code Execution appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: The Download: inside the Vitalism movement, and why AI’s “memory” is a privacy problem
item.description: This is today’s edition of The Download, our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology. Meet the Vitalists: the hardcore longevity enthusiasts who believe death is “wrong” Last April, an excited crowd gathered at a compound in Berkeley,...

item.title: ThreatsDay Bulletin: New RCEs, Darknet Busts, Kernel Bugs & 25+ More Stories
item.description: This week’s updates show how small changes can create real problems. Not loud incidents, but quiet shifts that are easy to miss until they add up. The kind that affects systems people rely on every day. Many of the stories point to the same trend: familiar tools being used in unexpected ways....

item.title: Cyber Insights 2026: Zero Trust and Following the Path
item.description: Zero Trust is not a thing; it is an idea. It is not a product; it is a concept – it is a destination that has no precise route and may never be reached. The post Cyber Insights 2026: Zero Trust and Following the Path appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Survey of 100+ Energy Systems Reveals Critical OT Cybersecurity Gaps
item.description: A study by OMICRON has revealed widespread cybersecurity gaps in the operational technology (OT) networks of substations, power plants, and control centers worldwide. Drawing on data from more than 100 installations, the analysis highlights recurring technical, organizational, and functional issues...

item.title: Google Disrupts IPIDEA Proxy Network
item.description: One of the largest residential proxy networks, IPIDEA enrolled devices through SDKs for mobile and desktop. The post Google Disrupts IPIDEA Proxy Network appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: How the grid can ride out winter storms
item.description: The eastern half of the US saw a monster snowstorm over the weekend. The good news is the grid has largely been able to keep up with the freezing temperatures and increased demand. But there were some signs of strain, particularly for fossil-fuel plants. One analysis found that PJM, the nation’s...

item.title: 3 Decisions CISOs Need to Make to Prevent Downtime Risk in 2026
item.description: Beyond the direct impact of cyberattacks, enterprises suffer from a secondary but potentially even more costly risk: operational downtime, any amount of which translates into very real damage. That’s why for CISOs, it’s key to prioritize decisions that reduce dwell time and protect their company...

item.title: Meet the Vitalists: the hardcore longevity enthusiasts who believe death is “wrong”
item.description: “Who here believes involuntary death is a good thing?”  Nathan Cheng has been delivering similar versions of this speech over the last couple of years, so I knew what was coming. He was about to try to convince the 80 or so people in the audience that death is bad. And that defeating it...

item.title: SolarWinds Fixes Four Critical Web Help Desk Flaws With Unauthenticated RCE and Auth Bypass
item.description: SolarWinds has released security updates to address multiple security vulnerabilities impacting SolarWinds Web Help Desk, including four critical vulnerabilities that could result in authentication bypass and remote code execution (RCE). The list of vulnerabilities is as follows - CVE-2025-40536...

item.title: Former ByteDance Executives Raise Eight-Figure Angel Round for AI Comics Startup “Pinecone Moment”
item.description: Founded by ex-ByteDance talent, the startup behind the “Pinecone Moment” AI comics app has raised an eight-figure angel round to develop its vision of an AI-powered platform for storytelling and digital companionship.

item.title: Distinct Healthcare Launches Hong Kong IPO, Brings in He Xiaopeng and Tencent-Linked AI Firms as Cornerstone Investors
item.description: Mid-to-high-end healthcare provider Distinct Healthcare launches its Hong Kong IPO, backed by cornerstone investors including He Xiaopeng and several Tencent-linked AI firms, following a profitable transition driven by its membership-based, family-care model.

item.title: ByteDance’s “Doubao Phone” Seeks a Reset as Second-Generation Model Targets Mid-2026 Launch
item.description: ByteDance is developing a second-generation Doubao smartphone for a mid-2026 launch while simultaneously pursuing system-level AI partnerships with smaller phone makers to expand its ecosystem beyond a single device.

item.title: Atomrobot Files for Hong Kong IPO, Ranks No.1 in China’s Parallel Robot Shipments
item.description: Atomrobot, a leader in high-speed industrial robots, has filed for a Hong Kong IPO under the 18C rules, reporting strong financial growth and claiming the top spot in China’s parallel robot market by shipment volume.

item.title: One small step for Cyber Resilience Test Facilities, one giant leap for technology assurance
item.description: CRTFs are helping organisations to make informed, risk-based decisions on the adoption of technology products.

item.title: PwC and Google Cloud Ink $400 Million Deal to Scale AI-Powered Defense
item.description: The announcement comes just weeks after Palo Alto Networks and Google Cloud announced a multibillion-dollar AI and cloud security deal. The post PwC and Google Cloud Ink $400 Million Deal to Scale AI-Powered Defense appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Google Disrupts IPIDEA — One of the World’s Largest Residential Proxy Networks
item.description: Google on Wednesday announced that it worked together with other partners to disrupt IPIDEA, which it described as one of the largest residential proxy networks in the world. To that end, the company said it took legal action to take down dozens of domains used to control devices and proxy traffic...

item.title: NeuroAI and Beyond
item.description: arXiv:2601.19955v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Neuroscience and Artificial Intelligence (AI) have made significant progress in the past few years but have only been loosely inter-connected. Based on a workshop held in August 2025, we identify current and future areas of synergism between these two...

item.title: Teaching LLMs to Ask: Self-Querying Category-Theoretic Planning for Under-Specified Reasoning
item.description: arXiv:2601.20014v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Inference-time planning with large language models frequently breaks under partial observability: when task-critical preconditions are not specified at query time, models tend to hallucinate missing facts or produce plans that violate hard...

item.title: Fuzzy Categorical Planning: Autonomous Goal Satisfaction with Graded Semantic Constraints
item.description: arXiv:2601.20021v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Natural-language planning often involves vague predicates (e.g., suitable substitute, stable enough) whose satisfaction is inherently graded. Existing category-theoretic planners provide compositional structure and pullback-based hard-constraint...

item.title: Insight Agents: An LLM-Based Multi-Agent System for Data Insights
item.description: arXiv:2601.20048v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Today, E-commerce sellers face several key challenges, including difficulties in discovering and effectively utilizing available programs and tools, and struggling to understand and utilize rich data from various tools. We therefore aim to develop...

item.title: Should I Have Expressed a Different Intent? Counterfactual Generation for LLM-Based Autonomous Control
item.description: arXiv:2601.20090v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large language model (LLM)-powered agents can translate high-level user intents into plans and actions in an environment. Yet after observing an outcome, users may wonder: What if I had phrased my intent differently? We introduce a framework that...

item.title: Gap-K%: Measuring Top-1 Prediction Gap for Detecting Pretraining Data
item.description: arXiv:2601.19936v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The opacity of massive pretraining corpora in Large Language Models (LLMs) raises significant privacy and copyright concerns, making pretraining data detection a critical challenge. Existing state-of-the-art methods typically rely on token...

item.title: DecHW: Heterogeneous Decentralized Federated Learning Exploiting Second-Order Information
item.description: arXiv:2601.19938v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Decentralized Federated Learning (DFL) is a serverless collaborative machine learning paradigm where devices collaborate directly with neighbouring devices to exchange model information for learning a generalized model. However, variations in...

item.title: oculomix: Hierarchical Sampling for Retinal-Based Systemic Disease Prediction
item.description: arXiv:2601.19939v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Oculomics - the concept of predicting systemic diseases, such as cardiovascular disease and dementia, through retinal imaging - has advanced rapidly due to the data efficiency of transformer-based foundation models like RETFound. Image-level mixed...

item.title: Continuous-Flow Data-Rate-Aware CNN Inference on FPGA
item.description: arXiv:2601.19940v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Among hardware accelerators for deep-learning inference, data flow implementations offer low latency and high throughput capabilities. In these architectures, each neuron is mapped to a dedicated hardware unit, making them well-suited for...

item.title: Latent Object Permanence: Topological Phase Transitions, Free-Energy Principles, and Renormalization Group Flows in Deep Transformer Manifolds
item.description: arXiv:2601.19942v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We study the emergence of multi-step reasoning in deep Transformer language models through a geometric and statistical-physics lens. Treating the hidden-state trajectory as a flow on an implicit Riemannian manifold, we analyze the layerwise covariance...

item.title: From Intuition to Expertise: Rubric-Based Cognitive Calibration for Human Detection of LLM-Generated Korean Text
item.description: arXiv:2601.19913v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Distinguishing human-written Korean text from fluent LLM outputs remains difficult even for linguistically trained readers, who can over-trust surface well-formedness. We study whether expert detection can be treated as a learnable skill and improved...

item.title: Simulating Complex Multi-Turn Tool Calling Interactions in Stateless Execution Environments
item.description: arXiv:2601.19914v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Synthetic data has proven itself to be a valuable resource for tuning smaller, cost-effective language models to handle the complexities of multi-turn tool calling conversations. While many frameworks and systems for producing synthetic multi-turn...

item.title: Modeling Next-Token Prediction as Left-Nested Intuitionistic Implication
item.description: arXiv:2601.19915v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We introduce the \emph{Arrow Language Model}, a neural architecture derived from an intuitionistic-logic interpretation of next-token prediction. Instead of representing tokens as additive embeddings mixed by attention, we encode a prefix as a...

item.title: PaperAudit-Bench: Benchmarking Error Detection in Research Papers for Critical Automated Peer Review
item.description: arXiv:2601.19916v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large language models can generate fluent peer reviews, yet their assessments often lack sufficient critical rigor when substantive issues are subtle and distributed across a paper. In this paper, we introduce PaperAudit-Bench, which consists of two...

item.title: PILOT: Planning via Internalized Latent Optimization Trajectories for Large Language Models
item.description: arXiv:2601.19917v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Strategic planning is critical for multi-step reasoning, yet compact Large Language Models (LLMs) often lack the capacity to formulate global strategies, leading to error propagation in long-horizon tasks. Our analysis reveals that LLMs possess latent...

item.title: T-Head Quietly Launches Official Website, Debuts In-House AI Chip “Zhenwu” Industry Sources: Overall Performance Comparable to Nvidia H20
item.description: Alibaba's semiconductor subsidiary T-Head has unveiled its self-developed "Zhenwu" AI chip, with industry analysts indicating its overall performance rivals that of Nvidia's H20 accelerator, marking a notable advancement in China's high-performance AI chip domain.

item.title: [AINews] Sam Altman's AI Combinator
item.description: a quiet day in the news lets us reflect on Sama's town hall message this week

item.title: Introducing Daggr: Chain apps programmatically, inspect visually
It's Time to Science
item.description: Why the time is right to start the world's first dedicated AI for Science podcast, and why AI Engineers should care

item.title: Service is operating normally: [RESOLVED] Elevated latencies for network change propagation
item.description: Between 7:08 AM and 10:48 AM PST, we experienced elevated latencies for network change propagation in the EU-WEST-1 Region. This was due to a delay in propagation of configuration updates on a sub-system which supports external and cross account connectivity. Customers experienced delays when...

item.title: Roundtables: Why AI Companies Are Betting on Next-Gen Nuclear
item.description: AI is driving unprecedented investment for massive data centers and an energy supply that can support its huge computational appetite. One potential source of electricity for these facilities is next-generation nuclear power plants, which could be cheaper to construct and safer to operate than...

item.title: Actions Workflows Run Start Delays
item.description: Jan 28, 15:54 UTCResolved - This incident has been resolved. Thank you for your patience and understanding as we addressed this issue. A detailed root cause analysis will be shared as soon as it is available.Jan 28, 15:37 UTCUpdate - Actions workflow run starts are delayed. We are actively...

item.title: What AI “remembers” about you is privacy’s next frontier
item.description: The ability to remember you and your preferences is rapidly becoming a big selling point for AI chatbots and agents.  Earlier this month, Google announced Personal Intelligence, a new way for people to interact with the company’s Gemini chatbot that draws on their Gmail, photos, search, and...

item.title: Elevated errors on Claude Opus 4.5
item.description: Jan 28, 14:14 UTCResolved - As of 06:12 PT / 14:12 UTC, we have mitigated the issue.Jan 28, 13:52 UTCUpdate - This is a repeat of the incident earlier in the day. Errors have restarted from 05:41 PT / 13:41 UTC.Jan 28, 13:52 UTCInvestigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: Linear representations in language models can change dramatically over a conversation
item.description: Language model representations often contain linear directions that correspond to high-level concepts. Here, we study the dynamics of these representations: how representations evolve along these dimensions within the context of (simulated) conversations. We find that linear representations can...

item.title: Elevated errors on Claude Opus 4.5
item.description: Jan 28, 12:30 UTCResolved - As of 03:50 PT / 11:50 UTC we have fully recovered.Jan 28, 11:47 UTCMonitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.Jan 28, 11:30 UTCInvestigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: SERA: Soft-Verified Efficient Repository Agents
item.description: Open-weight coding agents should hold a fundamental advantage over closed-source systems: they can be specialized to private codebases, encoding repository-specific information directly in their weights. Yet the cost and complexity of training has kept this advantage theoretical. We show it is now...

item.title: Elevated errors on Claude Sonnet 3.7
item.description: Jan 28, 10:36 UTCResolved - This incident has been resolved.Jan 28, 10:13 UTCInvestigating - We are currently investigating this issue.

item.title: SketchDynamics: Exploring Free-Form Sketches for Dynamic Intent Expression in Animation Generation
item.description: Sketching provides an intuitive way to convey dynamic intent in animation authoring (i.e., how elements change over time and space), making it a natural medium for automatic content creation. Yet existing approaches often constrain sketches to fixed command tokens or predefined visual forms,...
